items.title: Vanilla
items.description: Based on the ECMAscript specification *vanilla* or plain Javascript is making leaps with ES5 and ES2015 that support advanced syntax and features.

items.title: TypeScript
items.description:
A superset to Javascript, enforcing typing and advanced OO programming.

https://www.typescriptlang.org/
[typescript 2.2](https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/typescript/2017/02/22/announcing-typescript-2-2/)

items.title: Babel
items.description:
Babel allows developers to write in the modern ECMAscript specification, while compiling to a wide range of (older) browser support.

https://babeljs.io/

items.title: ES2015
items.description:
ES2015 is a highly anticipated successor to ES5 (2009) that implements features which makes Javascript a much better development language.

### State events
Edge browsers have almost fully implemented the spec:
* https://blog.mozilla.org/javascript/2017/02/22/ecmascript-2016plus-in-firefox/
* https://blog.chromium.org/2016/04/es6-es7-in-browser.html

items.title: ES2016
items.description:
ES2016 brings more advanced features to Javascript, but the language specification is in draft.

### State events
Edge browsers are working on implementing the spec:
* https://github.com/tc39/ecma262
* https://blog.mozilla.org/javascript/2017/02/22/ecmascript-2016plus-in-firefox/
* https://blog.chromium.org/2016/04/es6-es7-in-browser.html
